page.title: 03THE VILLAGE OF HILLESDEN
page.content: The most turbulent period in the history of the village was during the Civil War. Hillesden House was the home of the Royalist Dentons and was demolished by Cromwell's men. Until 1860 most of Hillesden belonged to the Dukes of Buckingham. In 1901 the land, with the exception of 3 farms, was purchased by Christ Church College, Oxford. In the recent past the land has been further divided, the majority in the hands of a business concern and two farms in private hands. A modern Hillesden House has been built close to the original site, incorporating within its bounds the remains of the moat which now serves as a swimming pool. There has been little new building in recent years but some renovation of older buildings has taken place. However these are mainly used as second homes or holiday houses
